definition[0]: the amount of money that a person or group has available to spend
definition[1]: the amount that a unit of money can buy
example[1]: The purchasing power of the local currency has halved.
definition[2]: the ability of a person or organization to buy things, depending on the amount of money they have available
example[2]: Inflation is also caused by too much purchasing power in the economy.
definition[3]: the amount that a unit of a particular currency buys at a particular time
example[3]: The purchasing power of the dollar has declined.
